intro: Rudgea miersiana, commonly known as the Miers' rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, lance-shaped, and have a smooth texture. Rudgea miersiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
